org.swerverobotics.library.interfaces

Interface IAccelerationIntegrator


  • public interface IAccelerationIntegrator
    IAccelerationIntegrator encapsulates an algorithm for integrating acceleration information over time to produce velocity and position.
    See Also:
    IBNO055IMU

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Acceleration getAcceleration()
      Returns the current acceleration as understood by the algorithm.
      Position getPosition()
      Returns the current position as calculated by the algorithm
      Velocity getVelocity()
      Returns the current velocity as calculated by the algorithm
      void initialize(Position initialPosition, Velocity initialVelocity)
      Initializes the algorithm with a starting position and velocity.
      void update(Acceleration acceleration)
      Step the algorithm as a result of the stimulus of new acceleration data.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(Position initialPosition,
              Velocity initialVelocity)
        Initializes the algorithm with a starting position and velocity. Any timestamps that are present in these data are not to be considered as significant. The initial acceleration should be taken as undefined; you should set it to null when this method is called.
        Parameters:
        initialPosition - the starting position
        initialVelocity - the starting velocity
        See Also:
        update(Acceleration)

      • getPosition

        Position getPosition()
        Returns the current position as calculated by the algorithm
        Returns:
        the current position

      • getVelocity

        Velocity getVelocity()
        Returns the current velocity as calculated by the algorithm
        Returns:
        the current velocity

      • getAcceleration

        Acceleration getAcceleration()
        Returns the current acceleration as understood by the algorithm. This is typically just the value provided in the most recent call to update(Acceleration), if any.
        Returns:
        the current acceleration, or null if the current position is undefined

      • update

        void update(Acceleration acceleration)
        Step the algorithm as a result of the stimulus of new acceleration data.
        Parameters:
        acceleration - the acceleration as just reported by the IMU
